findings.title: SD - Swap Duplication
findings.description: The contract performs two sequential swaps, resulting in a redundant swap.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the variable minimumTokensBeforeSwap can be set to a big number, triggering a huge token swap and potentially leading to significant price volatility.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases unnecessarily the gas consumption since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert on underflow and overflow.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure they cannot be changed after being set and decrease gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Not following Solidity naming convention guidelines which can decrease code readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can occur due to conditional statements that are always false, functions that are never called, or unreachable code, making a contract more difficult to understand and maintain.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: By adding the proper check, the contract will not allow the variables to be configured with zero value.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Usage of solidity assembly can make code difficult to read and understand.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
